data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063

|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.2|
|java|redhat|0.3.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Bind "editor.action.triggerSuggest" and "toggleSuggestionDetails" with "alt+/".
1.Reopen vscode, focus on text edit area.
2.Press ctrl+space (or other ). 

expectation:
Active Chinese ime, but no any response.

data.title: Setting custom terminal shell for a workspace doesn't work in more than one workspace
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.12.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In ".vscode/settings.json", set a custom workspace terminal shell. For example, to enable zsh on Max OS:
`
{
  "terminal.integrated.shell.osx": "/bin/zsh"
}
`
A bar appears on top of VSC and asks if you want to allow the workspace to manage the terminal shell. Click "Allow".
It works: the shell used in the terminal is the one that was defined

2. Try to do it again in another workspace, or in a third one. It doesn't work: the terminal remains the default terminal.

Can anyone else reproduce it?

data.title: Automatic Type Acquisition only partially retrieving types for project
data.body:
On a local project (I haven't worked out a minimal reproduction scenario, will do if that's valuable, this is my first try to use this [ATA feature](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/javascript#_automatic-type-acquisition), I've never seen it work :-/ ), Code seems to do its ATA, but only *partially*. Here are my deps:

```json
"dependencies": {
    "body-parser": "^1.17.1", "dotenv": "^4.0.0", "easy-table": "^1.1.0", "es6-promisify": "^5.0.0", "express": "^4.15.2", "express-session": "^1.15.2", "lodash": "^4.17.4", "minimist": "^1.2.0", "mkdirp": "^0.5.1", "morgan": "^1.8.0", "multer": "^1.3.0", "pouchdb": "^6.2.0", "pouchdb-find": "^6.2.0", "request": "^2.81.0", "request-promise-native": "^1.0.3", "session-file-store": "^1.0.0", "uuid": "^3.0.1", "winston": "^2.3.1", "connect-timeout": "^1.8.0", "JSONStream": "^1.3.1", "event-stream": "^3.3.4", "cors": "^2.8.3"
},
"devDependencies": {
    "ava": "^0.19.1", "eslint": "^3.19.0", "eslint-config-standard": "^10.2.1", "eslint-plugin-ava": "^4.2.0", "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.2.0", "eslint-plugin-jsdoc": "^3.0.2", "eslint-plugin-node": "^4.2.2", "eslint-plugin-promise": "^3.5.0", "eslint-plugin-standard": "^3.0.1", "file-fixture": "0.0.2", "nodemon": "^1.11.0", "nyc": "^10.3.1", "supertest": "^3.0.0", "tap-xunit": "^1.7.0"
}
```

But Code only does ATA for a subset of these dependencies, even though those are listed in `types-registry`. Here's a TS verbose log (selective, I picked what seemed to matter, please ask for more debug info as needed):

```
[Trace - 4:21:56 PM] Sending request: compilerOptionsForInferredProjects (1). Response expected: yes. Current queue length: 3
Arguments: {
    "options": {
        "module": "CommonJS",
        "target": "ES6",
        "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
        "allowNonTsExtensions": true,
        "allowJs": true,
        "jsx": "Preserve",
        "checkJs": false
    }
}
[Trace - 4:21:56 PM] Response received: compilerOptionsForInferredProjects (1). Request took 447 ms. Success: true 
Result: true
[...]
[Trace - 4:21:58 PM] Event received: beginInstallTypes (0).
Data: {
    "eventId": 1
}
[...]
[Trace - 4:22:00 PM] Event received: endInstallTypes (0).
Data: {
    "eventId": 1,
    "packages": [
        "@types/node@ts2.3"
    ],
    "success": true
}
[...]
[Trace - 4:22:23 PM] Event received: beginInstallTypes (0).
Data: {
    "eventId": 2
}
[...]
[Trace - 4:22:26 PM] Event received: telemetry (0).
Data: {
    "telemetryEventName": "typingsInstalled",
    "payload": {
        "installedPackages": "@types/inherits@ts2.3,@types/tape@ts2.3,@types/istanbul@ts2.3,@types/mocha@ts2.3,@types/benchmark@ts2.3,@types/supertest@ts2.3,@types/basic-auth@ts2.3,@types/debug@ts2.3,@types/depd@ts2.3,@types/on-finished@ts2.3,@types/on-headers@ts2.3,@types/split@ts2.3,@types/minimist@ts2.3,@types/mock-fs@ts2.3",
        "installSuccess": true,
        "typingsInstallerVersion": "2.3.2"
    }
}
[Trace - 4:22:26 PM] Event received: endInstallTypes (0).
Data: {
    "eventId": 2,
    "packages": [
        "@types/inherits@ts2.3",
        "@types/tape@ts2.3",
        "@types/istanbul@ts2.3",
        "@types/mocha@ts2.3",
        "@types/benchmark@ts2.3",
        "@types/supertest@ts2.3",
        "@types/basic-auth@ts2.3",
        "@types/debug@ts2.3",
        "@types/depd@ts2.3",
        "@types/on-finished@ts2.3",
        "@types/on-headers@ts2.3",
        "@types/split@ts2.3",
        "@types/minimist@ts2.3",
        "@types/mock-fs@ts2.3"
    ],
    "success": true
}
```
And, indeed, no `lodash` completion when `require`ing it and typing `_.`, and no types for it in the cache folder, which is populated but only for a subset of my `types-registry`-covered deps:

```bash
~ ls ~/.cache/typescript/node_modules/@types/
basic-auth  debug  inherits  minimist  mock-fs  on-finished  split       supertest
benchmark   depd   istanbul  mocha     node     on-headers   superagent  tape
```

Am I missing anything?

***Environment***

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS

***Steps to Reproduce***

1. `rm -rf ~/.cache/typescript/`
2. Open a JS project with a `package.json` specifying `dependencies`.
3. Wait for types to arrive, looking at `~/.cache/typescript/` and Output / TypeScript with `"typescript.tsserver.trace": "verbose"`.

data.title: panel.border isn't being applied when contrast color is specified
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: `1.12.1`
- OS Version: Linux x86_64

### Steps to reproduce
1. Add the following to User Settings:
```json
{
    "workbench.colorCustomizations": {
        "panel.border": "#ff00ff"
    }
}
```
2. Save the file

### What happens

The magenta color is applied to the same scope as `panelTitle.activeBorder`.

### What I expected

The magenta color to be applied to the panel border (the entire edge separating the editor).

data.title: GitHub repo clone not recognized by SCM
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:40:39.245Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.10.0-20-generic
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.11.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. git clone ... (from github)
2. cd project_dir
3. git commit ...
4. git push ...
5. git status ...
6. code .
-> workspace is opened in VS Code but not recognized as git repo
7. code
-> when project_dir is opened from File -> Open Folder result is the same as 6.

Not git repo info (branch etc) displayed at status bar, file changes not tracked.
Standalone git is working without issues in this dir.

![gui screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3155552/25761327/c72eff38-31da-11e7-89ca-a6de7126372b.png)

data.title: May Iteration Plan
data.body:
This plan captures the focus of our work during the May iteration. It's a 5 week iteration. We will ship **early June**.

## Endgame
- *May, 29th*: Code freeze for the endgame
- *June 2nd*: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in #27415.

## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend for annotations:

| Mark  | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |


## Plan Items

### Workbench
- [x] Design for multi root workspaces, multi folder, validate with user testing #396 @bpasero @tyriar 
- [x] Investigate restructuring Welcome page into Learn and Configure sections #22097 @chrmarti
- [x] Improve presentation of documentation in intellisense #18582 #25812 @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Emmet 2.0 support #21943 @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Improve theming support for Welcome page #25798 @chrmarti
- [x] Remember scroll position when switching between webviews #22995 @mjbvz
- [x] Add command to install additional SCM provider extensions #25696 @isidorn @waderyan
- [x] React to feedback for workbench theming [new colors](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-docs/blob/vnext/release-notes/v1_13.md#theming)@bpasero @aeschli 

### Editor
- [x] Find widget improvements #2657 #6158 #26498 @rebornix
- [x] Support to configure mouse/keyboard gesture for adding multiple cursors @alexandrudima 
- [x] Improve the snippet infrastructure (enable emmet 2.0, support multi cursor) @jrieken

### Monaco Editor
- [ ] :running: Improve [editor accessibility focusing on Edge+Narrator](https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen%20label%3Aaccessibility%20milestone%3A%22May%202017%22)  #26730 @alexandrudima 

### Install/Update
- [x] 64 bits windows install #507 @joaomoreno
  *update* for April we will only make a zip install available, full install update is planned for June
- [x] Investigate improving update experience. (See also, #24823 too many update prompts for users) 26199 @joaomoreno, @isidorn 

### Integrated Terminal
- [ ] :runner: :muscle: Support selecting and copy more than just the visible text in a terminal #9958 @tyriar 

### Tasks
- [x] Finalize and publish task provider API #23435 @dbaeumer
- [x] Support to associate problem matchers with contributed tasks #25518 @dbaeumer
- [x] Contribute tasks for scripts in the `package.json` (in a bundled npm extension) #27447 @egamma

### Languages

##### JavaScript/TypeScript
  - [x] Finish support for TS server plugins #25740 @mjbvz
  - [x] Improve TS editing experience #25842 @mjbvz
  - [x] Contribute tasks for building and watching TypeScript #26079 @mjbvz
  - [x] Initial preparations for adopting TS 2.4 in June #26080 @mjbvz 

##### Markdown
  - [x] Support quick outline for markdown #25574 @mjbvz

### Debug
- [x] Allow `remoteRoot` also for node "Launch" action #11681 @weinand
- [x] Explore - SSH based remote debugging (e.g. for Azure App Services, Containers) #26205 @weinand
- [x] Honor the optional `endLine` and `endColumn` attributes of `StackFrame` and `Breakpoint` #8851 @isidorn
- [x] Improve stepping performance #25605 @isidorn
- [x] Support to copy the entire text of the debug console #2163 @isidorn
- [x] Investigate improving the debug toolbar placement #2513 @isidorn

### Extensions API
- [x] Support to contribute a tree section to the explorer #26948 @sandy081 
- [x] Allow extensions to use theme colors #26974 @aeschli

### Extension Contributions
- [ ] :runner: Round up PHP language server PR https://github.com/felixfbecker/php-language-server/pull/357 @roblourens
- [x] Preview of a VS Code extension that bundles the tslint [typeScript server plugin](https://github.com/angelozerr/tslint-language-service) angelozerr/tslint-language-service#32 @egamma
- [x] VIM improvements https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/1706 @rebornix 

### Engineering Items

- [ ] :runner: Hire new team member #27092 @kieferrm
- [ ] Open [accessibility Issues](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue%20label%3Aaccessibility%20usability%20in%3Atitle%20OR%20accessibility%20in%3Atitle%20-label%3Aupstream%20is%3Aopen%20milestone%3A%22May%202017%22) **all**
- [x] Automate the Smoke test using Spectron #25291 @michelkaporin

##### Startup performance
  - [x] Improve startup performance using cached data, V8 snapshots #25229 @jrieken

##### Issue management
  - [x] Automate identifying, labeling, and closing stale issues #26223 @chrmarti
  - [x] Make it easy to verify that an issue is from an extension by supporting to disable all extensions in the extensions viewlet @sandy081

##### Build
  - [x] Can we use the TypeScript [`--noEmitHelper`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/compiler-options.html) option to reduce the compiled output size  and replace our custom solution #25612 @jrieken
  - [x] Review Multi-arch build configurations (armhf/arm64) for Travis CI #24943 @joaomoreno

### Documentation

Provide recipes for using VS Code with particular technologies
- [x] Debugging Docker with Source maps [See repository.](https://github.com/weinand/vscode-recipes/tree/master/Docker-TypeScript) @weinand 
- [x] Developing the MERN Starter in VS Code [See repository.](https://github.com/weinand/vscode-recipes/tree/master/MERN-Starter) @weinand 

----

### Deferred
- Make v2 the default and provide parity with 1.0 @dbaeumer
---
- Typescript - Investigate improving the development support for TS server plugins #26235 @mjbvz
- Improve extension API to better support extensions that provided synching of the vs code setup #14444 @sandy081
 - Improve `checkJS` experience with React #26081 @mjbvz
---
- Editor - Publish a new version of the monaco editor @alexandrudima 
- Editor - Investigate aligning column selection with other editors @alexandrudima
- Install - 64 bits windows install #507 @joaomoreno
- Debug - "Live Edit" [Node.js] #8127 #6930 @weinand
- Go https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/959 @ramya-rao-a
- Enable electron crash reporter for all processes #21944 @ramya-rao-a
- Continue investigation into markdown extensions #22916 @mjbvz

data.title: Feature: Add "stage lines" action/button to diff view for easier partial commits

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Inspired by [GitX](https://rowanj.github.io/gitx/), it would be useful to add a "stage lines" action/button for the selected lines in diff view. This would make the partial commit feature much more discoverable.

GitX:
![timey branch master 2017-05-05 11-26-15](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/173559/25759088/e220a5bc-3185-11e7-9814-8058ed04e5ea.png)

Mock:
![server js working tree - timey 2017-05-05 11-29-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/173559/25759178/20b0080e-3186-11e7-9f8b-bc2b8ca67f29.png)

data.title: Allow changing horizontal scrollbar height

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Horizontal scroll bars are too tiny. Please allow changing the height especially on the diff view.

data.title: Support terminal colors in solarized light/dark
